pr_title: Allow empty candidateSearchParams in EMPI module config.

timeline.message: Fix NPE in iterator, fix empi-rules.json, add extra tests
remove question, put in PR instead

timeline.bodyText: this doesn't look right to me.  if there are no criteria, then we still need to add the filter to cover the case where there is a filter but no criteria
timeline.author: fil512

replies.bodyText: This isn't that case. This logical block says:  If there are candidate search params, but the resource has no value for any of them, leave early. That's what this block is doing. The case where there are no candidate search params is covered by the null check on L51
replies.author: tadgh

replies.bodyText: I've removed the null check and instead just do an emptiness check
replies.author: tadgh

timeline.bodyText: is it possible for candidateSearchParams to ever be null?  I thought we validated this on json deserialization, but I could be wrong.
timeline.author: fil512

timeline.bodyText: these two tests definitely seem to cover the key issue
timeline.author: fil512

timeline.message: Add test in provider with different empi json rules
It is allowed to have empty candidate search params, so validator test is, ironically, invalid
